briefdescription.para: Callback type for vendor handling of HCI Vendor-Specific Events.

detaileddescription.para: A function of this type is registered with bt_hci_register_vnd_evt_cb() and will be called for any HCI Vendor-Specific Event.

simplesect.para: true if the function handles the event or false to defer the handling of this event back to the stack.

detaileddescription.para: This function allocates a new buffer for a HCI command. It is given the OpCode (encoded e.g. using the BT_OP macro) and the total length of the parameters. Upon successful return the buffer is ready to have the parameters encoded into it.

This function is used for sending a HCI command asynchronously. It can either be called for a buffer created using bt_hci_cmd_create(), or if the command has no parameters a NULL can be passed instead. The sending of the command will happen asynchronously, i.e. upon successful return from this function the caller only knows that it was queued successfully.
If synchronous behavior, and retrieval of the Command Complete parameters is desired, the bt_hci_cmd_send_sync() API should be used instead.

parameterdescription.para: Command buffer or NULL (if no parameters).

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used for sending a HCI command synchronously. It can either be called for a buffer created using bt_hci_cmd_create(), or if the command has no parameters a NULL can be passed instead.

The function will block until a Command Status or a Command Complete event is returned. If either of these have a non-zero status the function will return a negative error code and the response reference will not be set. If the command completed successfully and a non-NULL rsp parameter was given, this parameter will be set to point to a buffer containing the response parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Command buffer or NULL (if no parameters).

Place to store a reference to the command response. May be NULL if the caller is not interested in the response parameters. If non-NULL is passed the caller is responsible for calling net_buf_unref() on the buffer when done parsing it.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.

briefdescription.para: Get connection handle for a connection.

parameterdescription.para: Place to store the Connection handle.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.

briefdescription.para: Get advertising handle for an advertising set.

parameterdescription.para: Place to store the advertising handle.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.

detaileddescription.para: Register user callback for HCI Vendor-Specific Events

parameterdescription.para: Callback to be called when the stack receives a HCI Vendor-Specific Event.

simplesect.para: 0 on success or negative error value on failure.
